fields.headline: Ins and outs
fields.bodyText: Christine Gilbert, chief executive of Tower Hamlets council in east London for the past six years, is leaving to become the chief inspector for schools. She takes up the post in October succeeding Maurice Smith, who has held the post on an interim basis following the move of David Bell to become permanent secretary at the Department for Education and Skills. Just two months after quitting Staffordshire Ambulance Service to become interim chief executive of the Welsh Ambulance Service, Roger Thayne has resigned. Anton Van Dellen, who was Thayne's deputy at Staffordshire, has been named as interim chief executive. Ian Diamond has been reappointed as chief executive and deputy chair of the Economic and Social Research Council. The Centre for Public Scrutiny has announced that its chief executive, Jane Martin, will be leaving in October to take up a new position at Warwick Business School's Institute of Governance and Public Management where she will develop a research programme in public leadership. Adi Cooper, head of adult services at Lewisham council, south London, has been appointed as strategic director of adult social services and housing at the London borough of Sutton.
